"Saber otra idioma es como poseer una segunda alma."
This data shows that our K-12 public schools need to do a better job at preparing students for college so they do not need any remediation.
Federal BPS data from 2009 indicates that 68% of students beginning at 2-yr colleges in 03-04 had to take at least one remedial course.
A 2006 study (using data from the NELS:88) found that of students who take at least one remedial course, 28% complete college in 8.5 years
A @CommunityCCRC found that only 20% of students referred to remedial math go on to pass the relevant entry-level or "gatekeeper" course.
Currently, ~50% of college students are at 2-yr colleges: 70% of them are in remedial math class. Only 1 in 10 completes these math courses.
